revised_title: Investigation of Inner Electron Excitation in Zinc, Cadmium, and Mercury
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the excitation of inner electrons in zinc, cadmium, and mercury using electron impact. They discovered that the ultra-ionization potential losses in these elements could be explained by the excitation of inner electrons, a process that had not been previously recognized in electron collision experiments. This finding connects optical and X-ray spectra and provides a better understanding of atomic physics.
